ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Wakes up screaming during the night
Screams during the second half of the night
Needs to be read to before being able to fall asleep
Needs something to eat or drink before falling asleep
Requires medication to help sleep
Watches TV in bedroom
Sleep is worse after eating certain foods or beverages
Takes medications during the day that make him/her sleep worse
Throws tantrums at bedtime
Sleeps better in places other than his/her bed
Goes to bed at different times
Complains of the room or bed being uncomfortable
Sleeps more than other children his/her age
Is sluggish or irritable when awakened
Have you had trouble falling asleep or staying asleep. Severity
Notes: 0=Not at all distressing; 1=Minimally distressing; 2=Moderately distressing; 3=Markedly distressing; 4=Extremely distressing

ElementDescription: Can't move body when waking up or falling asleep
Takes frequent naps during the day
Stops breathing during sleep
Talks in sleep without knowing it
Gets less than 6 hours sleep in a 24 hour period
Engages in violent behavior while asleep (hits, kicks, punches)
Complains of jaw pain during the day or grinds teeth at night
Would stay in bed until gotten up
Is sleepy during the day
Sleeps longer or shorter periods on the weekends versus the weekdays
Walks in sleep
Wakes up screaming approximately 2 hours after going to sleep
Wets bed
Snores
Sleeps at inappropriate times or places
Needs a stuffed animal, toy, blanket, pacifier, night light to fall asleep
Sleeps less than children his/her age
Takes naps without being told or at an age when naps are not normal
Sleeps in a family bed
Has nightmares
Rocks body, bangs head, or rocks head in sleep
Resists going to bed at night
Expresses fear about going to sleep or is afraid to fall asleep
Has frequent leg movements while asleep

Parent: During the past month, how many hours of actual sleep does your child get at night? (This may be different than the number of hours your child spends in bed.)     Child/Self: During the past month how many hours of actual sleep do you get at / night?
Notes: -9=incomplete; 7777 = participant should have replied but did not (accidental or intentional skip); 9999 = No data (participant did not see/complete that scale)

ElementDescription: How many hours does your child nap during the day?
How many hours does your child sleep in 24 hours?
Do you think your child has a sleeping problem that affects his/her daily functioning?
Do you think your child has a sleeping problem that affects your family's daily
How many hours of sleep do you usually get on weekends (or days off work)?
How long does it usually take you to fall asleep after lights out?
Do you have nightmares?
Do you have sleep terrors?
Do you sleep walk?
Do you act out your dreams?
How often do you feel well rested after you first get out of bed?
Notes: 0= Never or almost never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Always or almost always

ElementDescription: How would you judge the overall quality of your sleep?
How often do you take naps?
Notes: 0= Rarely or never; 1= Less than once a month; 2= About once a month; 3= 1 or 2 times a week; 4= 3 or 4 times a week; 5= 5 or more times a week

ElementDescription: How long do you usually sleep during your naps?
Notes: 0= Between 10 to 30 minutes; 1= Between 30 to 60 minutes; 2= Between 1 and 2 hours; 3= More than 2 hours; 4= Does not apply to me

ElementDescription: Is your sleep affected by frequent leg movements?
If yes (sleep affected by frequent leg movements), do the leg movement arouse you from sleep?
While lying in bed before sleep or on awakening, have you ever experienced a restlessness of legs, ''nervous legs'', or a ''creeping or crawling'' sensation in the legs?
If yes (experience restlessness of legs while lying in bed before sleep or on awakening), how many times a week does this occur?
Have you ever experienced sudden muscle weakness or loss of strength, particularly when laughing or showing other strong emotions?
If yes (sudden muscle weakness at strong emotions), at what age did this start to occur?
How often do these (sudden muscle weakness at strong emotions) episodes occur?
Notes: 0= Rarely or never; 1= Less than once a month; 2= About once a month; 3= 1 or 2 times a week; 4= 3 or 4 times a week; 5= 5 or more times a week; 6= Nightly

ElementDescription: How often do you awaken with a headache in the morning?
Notes: 0= Never or almost never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Often; 3= Always or almost always

ElementDescription: What is your work schedule like?
Notes: 0= I work day shifts; 1= I work night shifts; 2= I work a mixture of night and day shifts; 3= I am unemployed or retired

ElementDescription: What is your occupation?
What time do you usually go to bed on school/work days? Military Time
What time do you usually wake up on school/work days? Military Time
What time do you usually go to bed on weekends/days off work? Military Time
What time do you usually wake up on weekends/days off work? Military Time
How many hours of sleep do you usually get on weekdays (or days you work)?
